q: side is Idol's revamped judging panel, which- with music titans Steven Tyler and J. Lo replacing snarling hitman Simon Cowell - has rejected acidic, dream-crushing honesty for a nurturing, sob-sister approach to talent wrangling. We oughta let her in the door, cooed Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler , oozing empathy for one off-key belter as J. Lo dabbed her eyes. "Water that flower'cause I think it's gon na grow!" of The X Factor in 2007. Discussing his boss with New! magazine, Dermot O'Leary praised Simon Cowell for having time for everyone. " Simon Cowell is a remarkably surprising, down-to-earth man," he said. You don't get that level of success if you haven't got a touch of normality. "He's very much a common man, someone you could go for a beer with and who you'd have no hesitation in talking to about anything at all. I clicked with him immediately. He is a really nice guy, not affected, and has time for everyone. He's a showman but his head's not in the clouds. He is not aloof. He added: " Simon Cowell is a businessman who makes some money and makes sure there are certain standards of performers there for a mass market." claimed that Simon Cowell is not the "ogre" some

crippled Shih Tzu, said any dog will bite if provoked-- citing Martha Stewart 's recent run-in with her own dog. Michael Hansen blames the pit bull's bad reputation on owners and the press. You have a tendency to sensationalize stories or put into them right down to the blood and gore when it isn't really necessary, said Michael Hansen , who has two dogs, 9-year-old Lab-collie brothers named Chaz and Zach. fanatics have other ideas. "We hear Susan Boyle has invited Simon Cowell and Piers Morgan , but both are busy so we'll dress up as them to get in!" said a couple of fanatics. I've already painted my teeth white and had my hair cut like a toilet brush! I look like a dead ringer now! boasted one of the fanatics. Museum, which houses thousands of ancient artifacts, was being protected by the army. Head of Antiquities, Zahi Hawass said on state television that it was not known if anything was stolen from the museum. There needs to be tighter security around the museum and fire trucks on standby. The museum can be set ablaze. This would be a disaster, Zahi Hawass warned.Firefighters were trying to extinguish the blaze at the headquarters of the ruling National Democratic Party.

In recent weeks, however, he has stayed largely silent on the proposal to cut benefits put forth by the fiscal-responsibility commission he appointed. I urge you to once again make clear to the American people that under your watch we will not cut Social Security benefits, raise the retirement age or privatize this critical program, Sen. Bernie Sanders wrote in a letter to Barack Obama . "Social Security is a promise that we can not and must not break." Sen. We will run out of money to pay the bills." Jerry Brown and state Controller John Chiang, who is charged with paying the state's bills, have yet to outline so dire a scenario. Donald Rumsfeld on Controversy Bath Salts: Sen. Chuck Schumer Looks to Impose Nationwide Ban Proposed Bill Would Make Ban Synthetic Drugs That Can Create "Legal Highs" 4 comments By BRIAN BRAIKER and KATIE MOISSE These so-called bath salts contain ingredients that are nothing more than legally sanctioned narcotics, and they are being sold cheaply to all comers, with no questions asked, at store counters around the country, Chuck Schumer said in a Feb. 1 statement.
